variable_description: ID number assigned by UKB to the participant

If the participant had measured BP at baseline >= 140/90, self-reported a diagnosis of hypertension or reported taking medications considered to be antihypertensive, then we considered them to have evidence of hypertension
variable_derivation: If mean BP at baseline >= 140/90 OR if the participant self-reported a diagnosis of hypertension in either the touchscreen questionnaire or the verbal interview, OR if the participant self-reported taking medication for their blood pressure or reported taking medications that are categorised as an antihypertensive treatment combination under the rubric.

variable_description: Among participants considered to have some evidence of hypertension, if the participant self-reported a diagnosis of hypertension in the touchscreen questionnaire or verbal interview, or reported that they were taking BP medication, then they were considered to be aware of their hypertension
variable_derivation: If the participant self-reported a diagnosis of hypertension in either the touchscreen questionnaire or the verbal interview, OR if the participant self-reported taking medication for their blood pressure or reported taking medications that are categorised as an antihypertensive treatment combination under the rubric.

variable_description: Among participants who were aware of their hypertension, if they self-reported taking BP meds or the list of medication they provided in verbal interview was found to include a standard hypertensive treatment regimen then they were considered to be treated for hypertension
variable_derivation: If the participant self-reported taking medication for their blood pressure or reported taking medications that are categorised as an antihypertensive treatment combination under the rubric.

variable_description: Among participants who were taking treatment for hypertension, if their mean measured BP at baseline assessment was < 140/90 then they was considered to be successfully controlling their BP
variable_derivation: The mean BP at baseline was calculated by taking the means of the systolic and diastolic measurements at baseline, either automatic or manual.

variable_description: Age of participant at baseline assessment
Participant's self-reported gender
Ethnic group of the participant
variable_derivation: "Chinese" and "Asian or Asian British" were coded as "Asian". "Other ethnic group", "Mixed", "Do not know" and "Prefer not to answer" were coded as "Other".

variable_description: Body mass index categorised into Underweight, Normal, Overweight and Obese
variable_derivation: BMI below 18.5 was considered "underweight", between 18.5 and 25 was "normal", between 25 and 30 was "overweight" and above 30 was "obese"

variable_description: Smoking status
variable_derivation: Prefer not to answer was coded as missing

varlabel: Total number of METs per week
variable_description: Summed MET minutes per week for all activity, including walking, moderate and vigorous activity.
Participant's average total household income before tax
Standard Occupational Classification group of participant's job, categorised from job titles self-reported in verbal interview
Education level of participant, coded under the ISCED levels of education
variable_derivation: "None of the above" = ISCED 1; "CSEs or equivalent" and "O levels/GCSEs or equivalent" = ISCED 2; "A levels/AS levels or equivalent" = ISCED 3; "Other professional qualifications eg: nursing, teaching" = ISCED 4; "NVQ or HND or HNC or equivalent" and "College or University degree" = ISCED 5

varlabel: Country of birth, categorised by income level
variable_description: The World Bank income categorisation for the participant's self-reported country of birth
variable_derivation: The country names from the UKB verbal interview data were matched to those of the World Bank classification, and the "Lower Middle" and "Upper Middle" categories were grouped to "Middle income"

variable_description: An indicator variable for whether the individual had been screened for bowel cancer, included as a proxy for utilisation of health care services
If any of the father, mother or siblings were reported to have high blood pressure, heart disease or stroke
variable_derivation: If any of the father, mother or siblings were reported to have high blood pressure, heart disease or stroke

variable_description: The date at which the participant attended their baseline assessment
NA
NA
NA
NA
NA
NA
NA
NA
NA
NA
The duration in years since the person received a diagnosis of hypertension
variable_derivation: The time in years between the recruitment date and the interpolated fractional year when hypertension was first diagnosed, as reported in verbal interview. If this is unavailable, then the difference in years between age at baseline assessment and the age at diagnosis, reported in the touchscreen questionnaire. If this is unavailable then *insert some form of imputation here?*

variable_description: The mean of the two systolic BP measurements recorded at baseline assessment
variable_derivation: The BP measurements could be either manual or automatic; the average of the two systolic measurements by either method was calculated

variable_description: The mean of the two diastolic BP measurements recorded at baseline assessment
variable_derivation: The BP measurements could be either manual or automatic; the average of the two diastolic measurements by either method was calculated

variable_description: An indicator variable for harmful alcohol consumption, defined as > 14 units per week for men, or > 7 units per week for women
variable_derivation: Average weekly intake of each kind of alcohol was summed and the total weekly units considered. This data was available for participants who said they drank alcohol more than once or twice a week, those who drank less frequently were not considered to have harmful alcohol consumption.

variable_description: An indicator variable for whether the participant had prior CVD
variable_derivation: Conditions categorised as CVD were: Stroke, Transient Ischaemic Attack, Angina and Myocardial Infarction

variable_description: Townsend deprivation index, a higher score implies a greated degree of deprivation.
An indicator variable for whether the participant's average daily METs exceeded 150
variable_derivation: The summed MET minutes per week were divided by 7 to get average daily METs

variable_description: The participant's body mass index, derived by UKB from the height and weight at baseline assessment
Waist circumference, measured by a nurse at baseline
The number of different antihypertensive drugs that a patient is taking (only applicable to those treated for hypertension)
variable_derivation: The number of distinct medications coded as "potentially BP medications" that the participant was taking, if they were considered to be on "probable BP meds" under the rubric

variable_description: Among participants who had said they were in paid employment or self employed, whether their job involved shift work

varlabel: Mean time to correctly identify matches in a game of Snap (seconds)
variable_description: The mean duration to first press of snap button summed over rounds in which both cards matched. It gives a crude approximation of the raw processing and reaction speed of a participant.
Among participants with a diagnosis of hypertension, the severity categorised as Stage I, Stage II or Stage III according to measured BP at baseline
variable_derivation: Stage I corresponds to systolic BP 140-159 mmHg or diastolic BP 90-99 mmHg, stage II mean systolic BP 160-179 mmHg or diastolic BP 100-110 mmHg, and stage III mean systolic BP>180 mmHg or diastolic BP>110 mmHg (also referred to as hypertensive crisis).

variable_description: An indicator variable for whether the participant had a chronic health condition
variable_derivation: There are 88 non-cancer illness codes categorised as other chronic co-morbidities, probably don't want to list them all here?

varlabel: Estimated hours of sleep per 24 hours (hours/day)
variable_description: Estimated hours of sleep per 24 hours (hours/day)
